title: Chelsea news: Antonio Conte says Chelsea fans should be worried when he is seated during a game | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Sunday 12 Feb 2017 10:08 am Antonio Conte usually goes mad when Chelsea score (Picture: Getty) 
Antonio Conte says sometimes he can be shocked by his own behaviour on the touchline, but insists he cannot change his ways. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
The Chelsea boss is well known for his crazy celebrations and dived into the the crowd when his side scored a second against Arsenal in the London derby. 
Eden Hazard’s wonderful solo goal sparked wild celebrations from Conte which fans have become used to since the Italian arrived at Stamford Bridge, 
But Conte admitted that sometimes his behaviour can make him cringe. 
‘It’s not easy for me to see me in this situation because I don’t like to see myself again after the game,’ he said. Chelsea fixtures 
Swansea (H) – Sat 25 Feb West Ham (A) – Mon 6 Mar Watford (H) – Mon 13 Mar Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr Conte and Chelsea are top of the Premier League table (Picture: Getty) 
‘It is not because I have a strange attitude or strange behaviours but because I don’t like to see it. 
‘Sometimes I’m a bit ashamed to show all this passion.’ 
He added: ‘ Sometimes for me it’s very hard to keep this passion under control. Conte celebrates Hazard’s goal. #CHEARS pic.twitter.com/aCdCS0fbBB 
— Contefy (@contefy) February 4, 2017 
‘Sometimes I want to share my passion with fans, with my staff, with players.’ 
Conte’s passion has helped fire Chelsea into a commanding lead at the top of the table with the Blues within reach of a 12 point cushion. 
Tottenham’s loss at Anfield against Liverpool on Saturday mean a win against Burnley on Sunday could send Chelsea 12 points clear at the summit. Conte has always been one for crazy celebrations (Picture: Getty) 
And Conte revealed that although his passion can be extreme, Chelsea fans should be worried if they ever see him sitting in his seat. 
‘As a manager this is my way,’ he said. 
‘It’s not good to judge someone who is always sitting during the game. Conte cannot hide his passion (Picture: Getty)
